column4: maybe using at is enough? sudo at "now +2 hours" <enter> shutdown -h now <crtl + D>
should I type the hole sentence "sudo at "now +2 hours" <enter> shutdown -h now <crtl + D>" in terminal window that way?
no <enter> is press enter key at that point. <crtl + D> is a combo
oh ok
pressing ctrl+D when in terminal inside at doesn't get out of that window
but you get back to the shell promt; right?
No.. I'm in at> shutdown -h now
sorry press enter. and do crtl + d on an empty line
you can put several commands in at
thanks
being @ at> and pressing ctrl+D doesn't go to shell promt.
works here
bizarre then.
maybe we have different keyboard layouts and CTRL+D works differently from each other... damn it.. now I don't know how to exit to shell promt.
crtl + c ?
no it doesn't work
crtl + d is universalyy EOF end of file in many unix commands
so I don't know what's going on here.
neither do I...
Pici here http://paste.ubuntu.com/478582/ you can see what I typed so far....
are you using screen or some other software that could capture the keys ?
no that i'm aware of.
